result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Tampering w/ a Global Positioning System Tracking Device

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy M Smith

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bond filed by Atty Anne Renc (sent to Br 1 Judge/JA on 11/01/22 sp)

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:05 PM Defendant Jeremy M Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Anne Renc in court for Jeremy M Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Robert Jambois in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case.
Atty Jambois states appearances.

Matter is set for a preliminary hearing.
Exhibit #1 is marked on behalf for Plaintiff. (copy of criminal complaint)

3:07 PM P.G. is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Jambois.
Witness identifies Defendant.
Exhibit #1 is referred to.
Defense has no objection.
BY THE COURT: Exhibit #1 is offered and received. 
Defense has no cross examination.

Defense has no argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Comply with the sex offender registration

11:09 AM Defendant Jeremy M Smith appeared by video, in custody.   Atty Anne Renc appears on behalf of the defendant.  Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls the case.
ADA Mutchler states the appearances.
Court questions Atty Renc as to why her client failed to appear on October 3, 2022.
Atty Renc states the reasons as to why he failed to appear on the record.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney requests that the preliminary hearing be held within time limits.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

State recommends a $50,000 cash bond with conditions as stated on the record.
Atty Renc objects to the cash bond and states her reasons on the record.
Defendant is public defender eligible.
Atty Renc would request a signature bond.
Court questions ADA Mutchler with regards to the defendant's prior cases.
Atty Renc provides additional information to the Court with regards to her clients cases.
ADA Mutchler responds.

BY THE COURT: 
Court sets a bond with conditions as stated on the record.
Warrant is quashed

ADA Mutchler states that victim notification would apply in the underlying cases.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jeremy M Smith
Current: 1504 Water St., Stevens Point, WI 54481   (Effective: 08-31-2022)
Prior: 1019 Arlington Pl, Stevens Point, WI 54481

2:50 PM Defendant Jeremy M Smith not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State requests a warrant.
Court reviews the file.
BY THE COURT: Warrant - body only
Initial Appearance set for 10/03/22 @ 2:30 p.m. in Br 3
